result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Daylin T Bridges not in court, in custody.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court for Daylin T Bridges.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court scheduled a motion hearing date with parties. Motion hearing is set for arguments and the courts decision. Case adjourned to Branch 45.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.

Case set for Motion Hearing. Defense motion to for severance heard. State unable to join cases for reasons stated on the record. Court GRANTED motion for severance. Defense also filed request for substitution. Case adjourned, Branch 45.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 15:

Defendant Daylin T Bridges in court with Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens.  Defendant Daylin T Bridges in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.

Case is scheduled for Order to Show Cause Hearing on today's date.  Atty. Givens advises the Court that he has been retained; further, defendant is prepared to waive his preliminary hearing.
Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court held colloquy with defendant.  Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. 
Court orders case adjourned for scheduling in Branch 15.
